title: Kinetic friction - block slides between two plates

content.question: A block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> slides between two rough plates as it moves downward without stopping. The sides of the block stay in contact with the plates throughout its motion and the plates exert constant normal forces on the block. In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the block has half its length between the plates, and the left plate exerts a force <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> on it. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the block is entirely between the plates, and the left plate exerts a force <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on it. In Figure <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, half of the blockâ€™s length has exited the plates, and the left plate exerts a force <math alttext="F sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> on it. Which of the following correctly compares the forces <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="F sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1, is less than F sub 2, which is less than F sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub 1, equals F sub 3, close parenthesis, which is less than F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub 1, equals F sub 3, close parenthesis, which is greater than F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
